text: Waltham Cross railway station, opened in 1840, is a railway station that serves Waltham Cross in Hertfordshire, England. It is also the closest railway station to Waltham Abbey, Essex, England. It is on the West Anglia Main Line, and train services are provided by Abellio Greater Anglia. During the 2012 Summer Olympics, Waltham Cross station (along with Cheshunt, the next northbound station) served as the main access point for the Broxbourne whitewater canoe and kayak slalom. ==References== ==Other websites== Category:Railway stations in Hertfordshire Category:Railway stations served by National Express East Anglia Category:1840 establishments in England Category:Railway stations opened in 1840
